channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Scenes you don't expect to see in America
item.description: Heavily armed, unidentifiable security agents dressed in camouflage have been snatching anti-racism protesters off the streets of Portland, Oregon, and bundling them into unmarked cars, with no clear justification. They're scenes you might expect to see in authoritarian countries, not in America.

item.title: The polls show Biden is a clear favorite 100 days out from an unprecedented election
item.description: Believe it or not, we're now 100 days and 15 hours from the 2020 election. As we enter the final stretch of the campaign, presumptive Democratic nominee Joe Biden continues to hold an advantage over President Donald Trump in the polls.

item.title: Columnist: If Martians saw this, they'd scratch their heads
item.description: New York Times columnist Thomas Friedman reacts to President Donald Trump's boast on Fox News about his results from a cognitive test, saying that if Martians came to Earth and saw the interview clip, they would be "scratching their head."

item.title: US tops 1,000 coronavirus deaths 4 days in a row as experts urge the country to shut down
item.description: Coronavirus deaths in the US topped 1,000 four days in a row last week amid ongoing debates on the return of school and mask mandates.

item.title: North Korea reports first Covid-19 case
US agents enter Chinese consulate compound in Houston after deadline for closure passes
Why did China choose the Chengdu consulate to retaliate?
item.description: China's Ministry of Foreign Affairs has ordered the closure of the US consulate in Chengdu days after the US forced the Chinese consulate in Houston to cease operations. CNN's Kristie Lu Stout reports.

item.title: New DNA study offers insight into trans-Atlantic slave trade
item.description: Much of what we know about the horrors of slavery in the Americas comes from historical records. But new research shows that evidence of the slave trade's atrocities can also be found in the DNA of African Americans.

item.title: Hong Kong's vast $3.8 billion rain-tunnel network
item.description: Below the mountains that overlook Hong Kong's financial district, drainage engineer Alex Lau is ankle-deep in water flowing into a giant tunnel almost twice the height of a double-decker bus.

item.title: Regis Philbin, television personality, has died at 88
item.description: Longtime television personality Regis Philbin has died, according to a statement shared by his family on Saturday. He was 88 years old.

item.title: Fleetwood Mac founder Peter Green dies at 73
item.description: Fleetwood Mac co-founder and influential blues rock guitarist Peter Green has died at the age of 73, his family's legal representatives confirmed on Saturday.

item.title: CNN's Don Lemon: Trump is being beaten by the coronavirus
item.description: CNN's Don Lemon gives his take on President Donald Trump announcement that there will not be Republican convention activities in Jacksonville, Florida.

item.title: Why the Netflix show 'Indian Matchmaking' is causing a stir
item.description: The new Netflix series "Indian Matchmaking" brings to light an ancient tradition that is still going on today.

item.title: He always dreamed of stepping foot on the moon. He made it there after his death
item.description: Today, we know Neil Armstrong, Buzz Aldrin and Michael Collins as the first men to land on the moon, 51 years ago. But, if not for a turn of events, history may have also known another name: Eugene Shoemaker.

item.title: Online survivor groups are a source of hope and support for those diagnosed with Covid-19
item.description: The posts come every few minutes. Members from South Africa to Arizona report their coronavirus symptoms. Someone asks for vitamin suggestions. Another user asks for prayers for their mom.

item.title: Police review reports of anti-Semitic posts from British rapper
item.description: Police are reviewing a string of anti-Semitic messages allegedly posted by the British grime musician Wiley on social media.

item.title: Naya Rivera's ex-husband, Ryan Dorsey, said her death left a 'hole' in everyone's heart
item.description: Ryan Dorsey, the ex-husband of 33-year-old Naya Rivera, posted a heartbreaking tribute to the actress on Instagram after investigators announced her death earlier this month.

item.title: England and Scotland went separate ways on Covid-19. It may lead to a full divorce.
A man using a prosthetic mask stole more than $100,000 at casinos, prosecutors say
item.description: A prosthetic mask, counterfeit driver's licenses, and personal information obtained on the internet. That's how federal authorities say a Michigan man allegedly managed to steal more than $100,000 from casino patrons in Michigan and Kansas.

item.title: Why a new generation of Black farmers is getting into the business
item.description: W. Kamau Bell visits Oklahoma to learn how politics and economic disparity has impacted family and independent farmers. Watch "United Shades of America" Sunday at 10 p.m. ET.

item.title: Manchester United in nearly-$100 million game against Leicester
item.description: Manchester United, Chelsea and Leicester City would have likely -- to use the expression -- "bitten your hand off" to be in the position they are now in the English Premier League.

item.title: Huge black bear spotted relaxing in a pool
item.description: A woman in Virginia was delighted when a large black bear decided to take a nap in a kiddie pool she had in her backyard.

item.title: Graduate fashion designer accuses Balenciaga of appropriation
item.description: An up-and-coming fashion designer has accused Balenciaga of appropriating her work, alleging that the luxury label posted an image to social media strikingly similar to one in her portfolio, which it had requested to see.

item.title: Mom's suicide left her hunting for female role models
item.description: An Olympic 10,000-meter runner turned marathoner by day, actor, director, screenwriter and author in all other spare hours she can salvage, Alexi Pappas rarely pauses for breath.

item.title: Sculpture at CIA headquarters holds one of world's most famous unsolved mysteries
item.description: In the middle of CIA headquarters, there sits a sculpture that contains a secret code that has stumped top cryptologists for decades.

item.title: Welcome to the real world, Mr. President
item.description: President Donald Trump gave in to the realities of Covid-19 when he canceled the plan to hold portions of the Republican National Convention in Jacksonville, Florida. Trump had insisted on moving some of the festivities to Florida after North Carolina Gov. Roy Cooper highlighted the dangers of hosting a major event during a pandemic. Now, with the surging virus ravaging the Sunshine State, the President is resigned to sticking to the original location and holding a pared-back convention in Charlotte.

item.title: Spanish footballing great Xavi tests positive for coronavirus
item.description: Xavi, considered one of the greatest midfielders of his generation, has tested positive for the coronavirus but says he is "ok."

item.title: Must-watch videos of the week
'No proof,' Official defends Sweden's Covid-19 move as mortality numbers soar
item.description: Sweden's State Epidemiologist Anders Tegnell tells CNN's Christiane Amanpour that, despite the country's high mortality rate, the no-lockdown strategy has "served us very well."

item.title: 'Top Gun: Maverick' release date pushed to summer 2021
item.description: Those feeling the need for speed are going to have to wait until next summer to see "Top Gun: Maverick."

item.title: Bill Gates has a message to Covid-19 conspiracy theorists
item.description: Microsoft founder Bill Gates responds to the many conspiracy theories and widespread falsehoods online about him and the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Here's what's in the Republican's stimulus proposal
item.description: CNN's Manu Raju reports on what is in the GOP stimulus proposal and what President Trump was not able to include in the plan.

item.title: Crowd saves two children from burning building
item.description: The two siblings, aged three and ten, escaped a fire that broke out, according to CNN affiliate BFMTV.

item.title: Alex Zanardi transferred to ICU, just days after moving to specialist rehab center
item.description: Ex-Formula One driver and Paralympic champion Alex Zanardi has been transferred to intensive care just days after he was moved to a specialist neuro-rehabilitation center.

item.title: Cruise fans explain why they can't wait to cruise again
item.description: Christine Beehler was on a two-week cruise voyage around South America when Covid-19 caught up with her ship.

item.title: How McDonald's plans to enforce its new mask policy
item.description: McDonald's and Chipotle announced they would soon require customers to wear masks or other face coverings as cases of Covid-19 surge across the United States.

item.title: He battled Covid-19 for 128 days. Here's what he wants you to know
item.description: "Miracle" Larry Kelly recovered from being infected with coronavirus. He spoke to CNN's Brianna Keilar about his experience after 128 days of hospitalization.

item.title: See inside Turkey's Hagia Sophia
item.description: The Hagia Sophia will hold Friday prayers for the first time in more than 80 years after Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan ordered its conversion into a mosque. A Turkish court annulled the 1934 presidential decree which made it a museum. CNN's Arwa Damon reports.

item.title: Michelle Obama-approved designer Duro Olowu's pursuit of the 'culture of style'
item.description: Ever since Nigerian-born British fashion designer Duro Olowu launched his eponymous label in 2004, his aesthetic has remained remarkably consistent. Known for his use of color and pattern, Olowu also favors the sharply tailored silhouettes of his multicultural 1970s upbringing, including fitted jackets, precision-cut wide-leg trousers, billowing capes and kimonos, and intricately cut yet liberating dresses with hemlines below the knee -- all rendered in vivid and unusually juxtaposed fabrics, patterns, and textures.

item.title: Ancient Roman artifacts found in seafood store
item.description: During a routine inspection in a seafood store, authorities in Spain discovered 13 Roman amphorae that could date back to the first century.

item.title: The pandemic's unlikely pet: Chickens
item.description: At the start of the coronavirus pandemic, the food supply in America was in question. Images of barren grocery store shelves, cleared out meat sections and empty freezer aisles littered the internet.

item.title: Twenty years on after soccer's most controversial transfer
item.description: The noise inside the Camp Nou on November 23, 2002, was unlike any other experienced in Barcelona's soup bowl of a stadium.

item.title: The all-female crew sailing the world to study plastic pollution
item.description: Emily Penn has studied marine plastic pollution for years. Then she discovered the issue may disproportionately affect women, so she put together an all-female crew to research the problem.

item.title: At least 45 arrested after protesters throw explosives at police
item.description: Seattle protesters threw large rocks, bottles, fireworks and other explosives at officers Saturday, police said. Others set fire to a portable trailer and a construction site, police said in a series of tweets.

item.title: Trump's mind-bending logic on school reopenings
item.description: As he tried to rescue his reelection campaign this week, President Donald Trump seemed to be in full retreat on key coronavirus topics -- from the efficacy of mask-wearing to the risks of holding the GOP convention in Florida. The one exception was school reopenings, which he has insisted must happen in person this fall.

item.title: North Korea reports first case of Covid-19
US agents enter Chinese consulate compound after deadline for closure passed
item.description: • Out of seven US consulates, why did China choose Chengdu?

item.title: China might worry about Google's move
Video shows US fighter jet fly close to Iranian passenger plane
item.description: CNN's Sam Kiley explains renewed tensions between Iran and the US after a US fighter jet did a fly by inspection of an Iranian passenger plane.
